contextId.information: The Pharisees are rebuking the Sadducees by affirming that spirits and angels do exist and can speak to people. AT: "Maybe a spirit or an angel has spoken with him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?

contextId.information: Paul is stating a hypothetical situation. If he were guilty, he would accept the punishment, but he knows that he is not guilty. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: Though if I have done wrong ... no one may hand me over to them
